programme.title: Alex of Venice
programme.desc: When a workaholic environmental attorney, Alex Vedder (Mary Elizabeth Winstead), is forced to reinvent herself after her husband (Chris Messina) suddenly leaves the family, Alex discovers her hidden vulnerability as well as her inner strength as she fights to keep her family including an aging father who still aspires to succeed as an actor, an eccentric sister and an extremely shy son, intact.

programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter
programme.desc: The last witch hunter is called upon to stop an evil uprising that could destroy humankind.

programme.title: Yentl
programme.desc: "In a time when the world of study belonged only to men, there lived a girl called Yentl..." Directed by and starring screen legend Barbra Streisand, a young woman takes her late brother's name and enters a Jewish religious school in early 20th century Poland. There, she masquerades as a boy in order to pursue her thirst for knowledge and befriends fellow student Avigdor (Mandy Patinkin) in this "Funny, delicate, and intense" (The New Yorker) musical drama of deep humanity and love.

programme.title: Nine
programme.desc: "NINE" is a vibrant and provocative musical that follows the life of world famous film director Guido Contini (Daniel Day-Lewis) as he reaches a creative and personal crisis of epic proportion, while balancing the numerous women in his life including his wife (Marion Cotillard), his mistress (Penélope Cruz), his film star muse (Nicole Kidman), his confidant and costume designer (Judi Dench), a young American fashion journalist (Kate Hudson), the whore from his youth (Stacy "Fergie" Ferguson) and his mother (Sophia Loren). The original 1982 Broadway production of "NINE," nominated for twelve Tony Awards and winning five, including Best Musical, was directed by Tommy Tune, choreographed by Thommie Walsh, starred Raúl Juliá with music and lyrics by Maury Yeston and book by Arthur Kopit. The 2003 Broadway revival of "NINE" received eight Tony Award nominations and won two, including Best Revival of a Musical.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Fatal Flaw" - Parents rush their baby to the hospital, but she tragically dies in her mother's arms. Now, Dr. G must help these devastated parents understand what happened.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Dive" - A train engineer panics when he spots a man lying on the tracks. He blows the whistle, but the train can't stop in time. It's up to Dr. G to piece together how Andy Santana died.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Decent" - It's up to Dr. G, along with the National Transportation Safety Board, to piece together how and why a plane crashed, leaving the pilot dead.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "A Deadly Deal" - Reed Baley is found unconscious the morning after his bachelor party. Now, it's up to Dr. G to determine if alcohol was to blame or if there was another cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Evil Intent" - Authorities respond to a fire, only to find Carolyn Casey's body at the center of the blaze. With little evidence and no witnesses, Dr. G must find the cause of death to catch her killer.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Disturbing Behavior" - Leo Guzman falls off a ladder while painting a house. At first, his death seems to be an open-and-shut case but, as the autopsy unfolds, Dr. G believes there may be more to this case.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Wounded" - A teen is eating breakfast when his dad starts stabbing himself. As the investigation unfolds, police begin to doubt the story. Dr. G must determine if this was a suicide or a murder.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Hidden Killers" - When Marie Allen visits her sister, she makes a gruesome discovery: the 49-year-old is dead on the couch. Now, it's up to Dr. G to figure out if this was an accident or something sinister.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Playing With Fire" - Dr. Farley discusses the bizarre case of a pregnant mother who suddenly dies. As the autopsy unfolds, Dr. Farley uncovers information that could have saved her and her unborn child's life.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Bite" - Roy Cambells is found dead and covered with scratches, his aggressive 80lb dog by his side. Dr. G wonders if the dog could have been responsible for the man's death.

programme.title: Portlandia:Bahama Knights
programme.desc: Carrie and Fred go home after a concert. Fred has an idea for a music documentary. Peter is reunited with his old band, The Bahama Knights and his ex-wife lead singer (Maya Rudolph). Guest starring Maya Rudolph, Tuck & Patti, and Jeff Tweedy.

programme.desc: A bohemian couple goes to great lengths to make sure that their restaurant order is ethical and humane. Guest starring Steve Buscemi and Jason Sudeikis.

programme.desc: A visiting biker makes Peter and Nance feel old and unsexy, prompting them to resort to drastic measures. Guest star Joanna Newsom.

programme.desc: The Mayor sends Fred and Carrie on a door-to-door mission to Seattle to recruit new citizens for Portland. A pedicab driver hustles for clients. Peter and Nance prepare for the opening of their Bed and Breakfast with a visit to The Doily Shoppe.

programme.desc: Peter and Nance practice hosting friends at the "Soft Opening" of their Bed and Breakfast. A magazine features a local furniture maker in their "Man Issue." Steampunks attend a convention. Fred takes a love interest on a bold third date.

In his routines, he weaves the story of his life as a bumbling jolly giant in his fast engaging storytelling style. He has been compared to Louie Anderson. Mark is a true road dog, performing in 40 states and all across Canada. Mark's ultimate dream is to do a film that people actually will have seen.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Crane Cannon Launch/Trash Scavenger Hunt/Heli Body Drag" - This episode featured four pairs as teams. First, it's the human cannonball. As a truck drives along a pier with a crane hanging off the side, one team member hangs from a crane and then into the water they light the fuse to giant cannon. Their partner is shot out of the cannon and into the water, swim to a boat and clip a flag to a flagpole. The team to finish fastest chooses team to be eliminated. Next, it's a trash can buffet scavenger hunt. Teams dig through dumpsters and barrels to find items. The team to match four items fastest would win a four-day trip to Las Vegas and $20,000. No one would be eliminated. The final stunt is a real drag. Team members hanging on to handlebars attached to a helicopter and are dragged across pavement on their stomachs. They have to let go as close to the finish line as possible. The team to get the least combined distance from the finish line would win $50K. The home invasion stunt goes to Dubuque, Iowa.

Now an outcast, he receives little help from his embittered fellow officers when he's hurled into a blistering battle against rival drug kingpins. But Cusack is a one-man army, waging war on the criminals with his razor-sharp wits, lightning-fast karate moves and a remote-controlled, rocket-equipped tank!

Thom continues his quest to meet Biba Struger, who claims to be immune to electrocution. Using electrical wires plugged into an electrical socket, Biba uses his body to complete the circuit. programme.desc:

Continuing his quest, Thom meets Brian Jackson with his unique lung power, inflating rubber hot water bottles until they explode. Brian attempts a feat beyond comprehension, to lift a 2 tonne truck with lung power. Thom brings in his experts to search for the secret to these amazing power.

programme.title: Erica
programme.desc: Marine biologist Erica has spent the past eleven years researching the smallest life forms in the ocean, phytoplankton. Through Erica’s eyes, the role of these microorganisms in the marine ecosystem is clarified. Her dream is to swim with humpback whales, so David and his team are determined to make it happen.

programme.title: Jess
programme.desc: Environmental philosophy student Jessica is looking to go beyond the surfing experience and see what more the ocean has to offer. Hanli steps up and instructs Jessica in the art of free diving. Her first dive is in a protected cove in a Marine Protected Area in False bay. The episode ends on a high note as Jessica and the crew enjoy an encounter with a pod of pilot whales.

programme.title: Paseka: The Easter Elephant
programme.desc: On Easter morning, a baby elephant is mysteriously abandoned by her herd in the wilds of Botswana’s Okavango Delta. Saved from certain death by a bizarre chain of events, she forces herself into a very unusual, captive elephant herd. This is “Paseka's” story.

programme.title: Life On Us: A Microscopic Safari
programme.desc: Just like planet Earth, our body is composed of diverse landscapes surprising wildlife. This award-winning film offers a unique microscopic safari, encountering the creatures that live, compete, feed, on breed on the surface or in the depths of our body. Some may seem harmful, others are useful and even essential to our survival, but all participate in the biological balance of the human body.

programme.title: Monwabisi
programme.desc: Monwa’s life is tied to the sea. However, his relationship to the marine environment is based in fear. David and the crew aim to help him overcome this fear by getting him into the water. Monwa learns to free dive, and once the crew is satisfied that he can handle more, Monwa takes the plunge and swims with blue sharks in an underwater canyon off the coast of the Cape of Good Hope.

programme.title: Africa's Primeval Oceans
programme.desc: The scene is the southern tip of Africa. Just off shore, two very different seas meet to form one of the most diverse marine environments on earth. The meeting of icy Atlantic and warm Indian waters not only affect life underwater, they are giant forces that shape the land, climate, and all its creatures. The Portuguese explorer Bartholomew Dias and his crew called it the Cape of Storms.

programme.title: Mythical Chef Josh and Nicole Russell Make Taco Bell and Beef Patty Inspired Pizzas | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Pizza is the ultimate blank canvas for culinary innovation. In this episode of Pizza Wars, host Nicole Russell faces off against Mythical Chef Josh to see who can create the ultimate "mashup pie." At Mythical Kitchen, Josh has perfected the art of fast-food fusion, but will his Doritos Locos Taco Pizza be enough to take down Nicole's Jamaican beef patty-inspired pie? The choice is up to this week's judges: Complex's Speedy Morman and chef Jae Lee of Nowon in NYC.

programme.title: Neapolitan-Style Pizza at Home with Vito Iacopelli, Nicole Russell, and Daym Drops | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: It's the season finale of Pizza Wars, and host Nicole Russell must now battle the final boss: master pizzaiolo Vito Iacopelli. Will Nicole's tandoori-inspired pizza be enough to impress food review legend Daym Drops, or will Vito's "connolo-style" slice steal the golden pizza trophy away from her for good? Only one oven can handle a pizza cage match of this magnitude: The Ooni Koda 16. Tune in to a very special episode of Pizza Wars to see who comes out on top.

programme.title: An Open Conversation about Kanye West

programme.title: Joji Judges a Boba Tea Battle Between Rich Brian and NIKI
programme.desc: Boba is one of the world's most beloved beverages. But what happens when NIKI and Rich Brian decide to trick out their drinks with some crazy toppings? After learning the bubble-tea basics from Boba Guys founder Bin Chen, NIKI and Brian go head-to-head in the boba battle of the century. Gummy bears? Check. Gushers? Check. Pop Rocks? Check! The only thing keeping NIKI and Brian from achieving bubble tea perfection is the limits of their own imaginations.

programme.title: Racks Most Expensive Supreme Purchase & Air Jordan 4 Levi's!

programme.title: NIKI and Inga Lam Share Indomie Noodle Hacks
programme.desc: Indomie is one of Indonesia's most beloved cultural exports. But what happens when you use mie goreng to make burgers and chocolate bars? Indonesian icon NIKI has been an Indomie purist since day one, but today she's teaming up with BuzzFeed's Inga Lam in the hopes of broadening her stir-fried noodle horizons. Together, NIKI and Ingra run through a few of their favorite ways to trick out a pack of instant noodles. Which mie goreng metamorphosis is NIKI's favorite?

programme.title: The Ultimate Regional Burger Road Trip with a Burger Scholar
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz and Alvin Cailan are going on the ultimate regional burger road trip-which includes a pit stop to eat America's original hamburger. Motz is a veteran road warrior: he's logged thousands of miles in his car chasing down burgers all over the country.

programme.title: Joji and Sean Evans Review Japanese Snacks
programme.desc: Joji is here to help Sean Evans navigate the often overwhelming world of the Japanese convenience store. Born and raised in Japan, the 88rising crooner takes our host on a snack-fueled journey through the Land of the Rising Sun.

programme.title: How New Orleans Birthed a Vietnamese Po Boy Movement
programme.desc: We head to New Orleans. Forty years ago, Vietnamese migration to NOLA introduced bánh mì to po' boy country. Now, the lines between two iconic sandwiches are blurring. To find out what happens when you mash up the Mississippi Delta and the Mekong Delta, we spoke to New Orleans legend Curren$y, Times-Picayune writer Brett Anderson, and Banh Mi Boys chef Peter Nguyen.

programme.title: Filipino Food 101 With Jo Koy
programme.desc: When it came time for Sean Evans to dive head first into the menu at Jeepney Filipino Gastropub in NYC, the choice for a dinner companion was a no-brainer.

programme.title: Mike Chen and Claire Saffitz Explore Japanese Street Food and Candy
programme.desc: Japan Village is a 20,000-square-foot food hall in Brooklyn's Industry City, and Reina Scully is ready to explore every corner. But no food tour is complete without a few friends. Joining Reina on her adventure is Strictly Dumpling's Mike Chen, Bon Appétit's Claire Saffitz, and NYC restaurateur Sakura Yagi.

programme.title: Wagyu 101 with Sean Evans and Philip DeFranco
programme.desc: Japan is home to some of the world's most coveted cuts of meat. But what makes wagyu so expensive? From an $85 wagyu sando with Hot Ones host Sean Evans, to a $350 wagyu steak with her old boss Philip DeFranco, Reina Scully is eating her way through NYC's most decadent hunks of Japanese beef with a couple of friends. But what gives wagyu its famously marbled fat? And what's the deal with American wagyu popping up at restaurants?

programme.title: Frank Pinello and Mark Iacono Eat "Japanese Pasta"
programme.desc: Last week, Reina Scully ate her way through three of Japan's most recognizable ramen styles. But today, she's on a mission to see where ramen is going next. Her first stop is Niche, where chefs Frank Pinello, Mark Iacono, Carlo Carciotto, and Anthony Vitolo are ready to try mazemen, a saucy, brothless style of ramen. Chef Shigetoshi "Jack" Nakamura calls this dish "Japanese pasta"-but will his cheese and bacon-topped noodles satisfy some of NYC's most beloved Italian-American chefs?

programme.title: Meek Mill & Lil Baby Albums, Jay Explains 'What's Free' Line, Em's 'Kick Off'
programme.desc: Nadeska, Wayno and DJ Akademiks review the latest projects released by Meek Mill and Lil Baby. After dropping 'Wins & Loses' in 2017, Meek returned last week with the release of his fourth studio album, 'Championships.' The new LP, which features a star-studded line-up of guest appearances, is highlighted by the Jay-Z and Rick Ross-assisted track, "What's Free," as well as the Drake and Meek collab joint "Going Bad.

programme.title: Kanye Still Obsessing About Drake, Bobby Shmurda Dropping a Tape From Prison?
programme.desc: On Tuesday's (Jan. 28) episode of #EverydayStruggle, Nadeska, Wayno and DJ Akademiks continue to mourn the loss of legendary basketball player Kobe Bryant, and his 13-year-old daughter Gianna Bryant. The crew shares the latest updates of the helicopter accident investigation, and also speak on 50 Cent announcing that Kobe's death has made him a changed man.

programme.title: Will Smith And Martin Lawrence Go Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Will Smith and Martin Lawrence go Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Stadium Goods in NYC, and talk about setting trends on their sitcoms, getting their own sneaker collabs and footwear choices in "Bad Boys For Life."

programme.title: Matty Matheson and Sean Evans Have a Poutine Showdown
programme.desc: Poutine is a Montreal staple-a glorious combination of fries, cheese curds, and gravy that ranks as one of the world's great hangover cures.

programme.title: Jimmy Fallon Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Complex's Joe La Puma goes Sneaker Shopping with the host of the Tonight Show, Jimmy Fallon, at Flight Club in New York City to talk about his history in sneakers, getting dissed by Barneys' employees back in the day, and Hasan Minhaj hooking him up with Air Jordan 1s.

programme.title: Tory Lanez Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Tory Lanez goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Flight Club in Los Angeles and talks his love for the Air Jordan VI, why he looks up to Vince Carter, and growing up in Toronto.

programme.title: Lawrence Taylor Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: New York Giants legend Lawrence Taylor goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Kith in Miami and talks about playing golf with Michael Jordan, his game worn cleats selling for $11,000, and Eli Manning's golf handicap.

programme.title: Carmelo Anthony Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Carmelo Anthony goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe la Puma at Saint Alfred in Chicago and talks his favorite signature NBA sneakers growing up, getting his own Air Jordan PEs, and the importance of the Air Jordan X "Wings" and its influence from Chicago.

programme.title: Tracy Morgan Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Comedian and actor Tracy Morgan goes Sneaker Shopping with Joe La Puma at Flight Club in New York City and talks about his love of classic footwear, the one time he got a pair of sneakers stolen from him and his favorite courtside footwear.

programme.title: Pop Smoke Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Pop Smoke goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Stadium Goods in New York City and talks about playing basketball in high school, the first Air Jordans he owned, and going to Paris Fashion Week and connecting with Virgil Abloh and Louis Vuitton.

programme.title: Lil Nas X Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: "Old Town Road" star Lil Nas X goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Flight Club in Los Angeles and talks about his new-found fame, how he's going to spend his money, and more.

programme.title: Marcus Jordan Reveals Never-Before-Seen Air Jordans
programme.desc: Full Size Run is Sole Collector's weekly sneaker talk and debate show featuring co-hosts Brendan Dunne, Matt Welty, and Trinidad James, and this week they're joined by Marcus Jordan, the CEO of Trophy Room and Michael Jordan's son. He tells crazy stories about his father, shows off never-seen-before Air Jordans, and talks about running a sneaker store.

programme.title: Drag Kids
programme.desc: Drag has always been about breaking down barriers and daring to do the unexpected. Now, a new type of queen is on the scene: she's fierce, she's living in a time of unprecedented access to queer culture, and she's younger than ever before. She's a drag kid and she's a long way from the era of the queens who led the Stonewall Riots nearly 50 years ago. Stephan, Jason, Bracken and Nemis have never met, but they're united by a shared passion for drag. They are about to come together for the first time - to perform Lady Gaga's 'Born This Way' at the world-famous Montreal Pride Festival. As they prepare for the big show, each faces their own unique challenges, as well as challenges they have in common - deep feelings of isolation and the struggle of trying to claim a place of your own on the fringes of a fringe culture. Drag Kids is a beautiful, daring, and touching portrait of four kids chasing freedom and friendship through the art of drag.

programme.title: Scrum
programme.desc: The lives of a self-assured Canadian jock, a rookie Irish backpacker and a stoic Japanese outsider change when they vie for a position in the grueling Bingham Cup.

programme.title: The Q Agenda
programme.desc: S3 E6 | In this episode of The Q Agenda, actor and musician Terrell Carter tell his incredible story of a uniquely dysfunctional family in the book Problem Child. Plus, Jorge Gutierrez of Familia: The Trans Liberation Movement, and we discuss our backgrounds to better understand the LGBTQ Community's relationship with organized religion.

programme.title: Girl Gets Girl
programme.desc: Inés has lived the American dream in Miami for 10 years. When she's caught cheating on her girlfriend, her world tumbles down. For the first time in years Inés asks herself what she wants in life: It's time to get back to Spain.

programme.title: The Library
programme.desc: As we seek to honor and celebrate the countless LGBTQ individuals, communities, sub-communities, and dynasties that have flourished in the face of adversity over decades, it dawned on us that there are so many unknown and untold stories about gay history, vocabulary, vernacular, and the human experiences that fuel the formation of cultures and identities based on authentic self-expression and love. As we discovered these stories, we wished for a gay "library" where anyone could visit and learn, in bite-size portions, about crucial events in gay history, gay heroes and icons past and present, fascinating sub-cultures, slang terms, scientific references, political movements... Essentially, a record of all the bits of queer education that are at risk of being lost or misinterpreted — information that we all crave as members of LGBTQ communities and as Allies. Do you know the story of the first Pride parade? Ever wondered what "Skoliosexual," "Polycule," or "Doppelbanger" means? The Library is open — and ready to clue you in.

programme.title: My Transgender Summer Camp
programme.desc: Features exclusive access to an American camp for transgender adolescents and their parents. The film My Transgender Summer Camp explores the difficult next steps faced by a group of ordinary girls who were born boys. As well as summer fun, they must face huge dilemmas including whether or not to begin hormone blockers to halt male puberty.

programme.title: The Billionaire
programme.desc: A gender-swapped independent film adaptation of George Bernard Shaw's classic play 'The Millionairess', transposed into a contemporary context of Gay Marriage and Asexuality, THE BILLIONAIRE follows a haughty and prudish young billionaire's quest for love, despite all the odds. The film is a throwback to Classic Hollywood films, stylistically and tonally.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.desc: When a man is gunned down in his own garage, police discover that a wound sustained by the grieving widow may have been self-inflicted. They turn to science to help unravel a twisted tale of lust, greed and deception.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond and co-host Amanda Byram return to guide 20 foolhardy Brits through the biggest and daftest obstacle course in the universe. From giant hammers that smack them in the face, to the Shapeshifter and the Big Red Balls, each contestant braves the Qualifier to try and qualify for Double Cross.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Life really doesn't get much more fabulous than watching 20 hopeful - and sometimes hopeless - ordinary British folk fly halfway across the world to test their skill, endurance, nerve and bouncability on the incredible Total Wipeout course in Argentina. There is a cash prize waiting for the winner, plus a shiny trophy, a lifetime of amusing anecdotes, and a nickname from host Richard Hammond.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Total Wipeout, the biggest, brashest and most exhausting game show on television, is back for more bangs, bumps, and bruises. This episode sees the return of the finalists from across the series as they compete for the ultimate title, 'Champions of Champions'. They pit themselves against some of the hardest obstacles we've ever witnessed on their journey to get to the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond dons his tuxedo for a special program honoring the heroes of Total Wipeout's fifth series. The presenter starts with the 'Best new obstacle award' and will be showing the top five, and the winner for each category. Don't miss out on this special episode because surely, it will make you have good laughs!

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the first 'Celebrity Special' of the season. Today, Richard Hammond presents an extraordinary game show in which ten celebrities tackle one of television's most extreme obstacle courses to win 10,000 pounds for charity. Celebrities are Dalton Grant, Ricky Groves, Gail Emms, Charlie Stayt, Roxanne Pallett, Simon Day, Brian Belo, Camilla Dallerup, Nicola McLean and Julie Peasgood.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Time again for the world of celebrity to take on the world's most outrageous obstacle course in the name of charity, and in the name of slapstick entertainment! Richard Hammond and Amanda Byram watch the likes of Marcus Patric, Peter Duncan, Susie Amy, Chris Rankin, Donna Fraser, Clare Nasir, Neil Ruddock, Melissa Suffield, Lady Sovereign, and Dom try to make it to the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Into the Blue S13:E5 "From the bottom to the Top"
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger invite Capt. Brice Barr along for mixed bag day off Key West.

programme.title: Into the Blue S13:E6 "The King Bite"
programme.desc: Kingfishing off Key West is a great option during the fall.

programme.title: Local Knowledge S6:E5 "The Slow Pitch"
programme.desc: With slow pitch jigging being the newest craze, Rush and buddy Dane head out to test some new tackle and go for “mutton or nothing.” Meanwhile in California, Ali gets his hand on the new gear and prepares to hop a flight and join in on the “slow pitch” party with the guys in Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge S6:E6 "Tails and Teeth"
programme.desc: When the weather in San Diego throws the crew a curveball, Ali, Rush and friend Brandon Nelson put together plan B. Targeting Yellowtail and Mako sharks, the guys search for kelp paddies on the horizon and look to friend at the fish house for some “shark attractant” to make it all come together.

programme.title: Fly Rod Chronicles S17:E1 "Fly Fishing England Pt1"
programme.desc: Curtis heads across the pond to England to explore some of the most famous rivers in the world. Watch as Curtis and his buddy Rick Heim travel across the UK taking in all the culture and ofcourse catch some amazing fish!

programme.title: Fly Rod Chronicles S17:E2 "Fly Fishing England Part 2"
programme.desc: On this episode of Fly Rod Chronicles Curtis and the crew stays in England for Fly Fishing England Pt2, they take in some more history about the birthplace of fly fishing and catch some huge fish on the fly!! You have to watch this epic show!!

programme.title: Fly Rod Chronicles S17:E3 "Fly Fishing for a Cure"
programme.desc: Curtis teams up with legendary NCAA head coach Bob Huggins for the 7th annual Fish Fry to raise money for his two foundations the Norma May Huggins Foundation and Remember the Miners that gives scholarships to kids that lost there loved ones in mining accidents. The event is held at the beautiful Harman's Cabins in West Virginia.

programme.title: Uncharted Waters with Peter Miller S4:E3 "Peter and his daughter Emily, target Mahi Mahi, Peacock Bass, Largemouth Bass and Tarpon in Miami."
programme.desc: Peter and his daughter Emily catch Mahi Mahi offshore, Peacock and Largemouth Bass in their backyard and travel to downtown miami to catch Tarpon and are treated to an epic sashimi dinner at Uchi Miami with James Beard award winning chef, Tyson Cole.

programme.title: Uncharted Waters with Peter Miller S4:E4
programme.desc: Peter travels 220 miles by boat to Harbour Island, Bahamas trolling for big kingfish, live baiting for tuna and bottom fish for big mutton snapper along the reef. Afterwards they take a swim with and hand feed the famous Green Sea Turtles and cut up some tuna on the way in for some sunset sashimi. PART 1

programme.title: WPT Greatest Season 2 Episode 11
programme.desc: WPT Greatest Tales from the Felt takes a look back at the most legendary final tables in WPT history. On this episode, we revisit the final table at season four’s, Five Diamond World Poker Classic from Bellagio in Las Vegas. This final table was tough and featured Doyle Brunson, JJ Liu, Patrik Antonious, the “Unabomber” Phil Laak, and “Gigabet” Darrel Dickens. The amateur at the table was Rehne Pederson who got in off of $100 online tournament. They are all competing for a chance to win over 2 million dollars. With a star studded final table the competition is tough and the poker player is some of the best ever at a WPT final table.

programme.title: Holiday Cookies
programme.desc: The holidays are stressful enough. Dough that sticks to the rolling pin, cookies that melt together in the oven, and glazes that refuse to set up just won't do. We create a foolproof rolled butter cookie dough that tasted great and can be turned into an array of different cookies.

programme.title: Old-Fashioned Birthday Cake
programme.desc: In this episode, we aim to resurrect the traditional birthday cake. No tiramisù takeoffs or cupcake shortcuts need apply. We've developed an honest-to-goodness layer cake with an old-fashioned jam filling and real butter frosting-the type of cake guaranteed to put a smile on anyone's face.

programme.title: Dinner on a Dime
programme.desc: We investigate inexpensive steaks and also take a look at a classic accompaniment to steak: mashed potatoes.

programme.title: Lighter Family Favorites
programme.desc: Whether we admit it or not, there are some dishes that, while tasty, are just too high in fat and calories to be enjoyed on a regular basis. Even a modest portion of macaroni and cheese or chicken Parmesan is prohibitive. But that doesn't need to be the case.

programme.title: Two Ways with Pork
programme.desc: Boneless pork chops are lean and quick-cooking, making them ideal for weeknight meals. Pork tenderloin, which is also lean, has a somewhat fussy reputation, perhaps due to the fact that this cut is often more familiar at a restaurant table than the home kitchen. But that doesn't mean you need to be a professional chef to cook tenderloin properly.

programme.title: Regional Italian-American Favorites
programme.desc: Test cook Bryan Roof makes host Julia Collin Davison a New York classic, Prosciutto Bread. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Bridget Lancaster to a tasting of provolone cheese. Finally, test cook Ashley Moore shows Bridget how to make the easiest-ever Drop Meatballs.

programme.title: Fish Tacos and Steak Fajitas
programme.desc: Test cook Bryan Roof and host Bridget Lancaster prepare a Southern California classic, Smoked Fish Tacos. Next, equipment expert Adam Ried shows host Julia Collin Davison his top pick of chimney starters. Finally, test cook Christie Morrison makes Julia Grilled Steak Fajitas.

programme.title: Cast-Iron Comforts
programme.desc: Bridget Lancaster uncovers the power of the cast iron, showing host Julia Collin Davison how to achieve restaurant-worthy homemade pizza, made in a cast iron skillet. Next, Adam Ried reviews his top choice for the best Cast Iron Skillet on the market. And finally, test cook Ashley Moore teaches Bridget how to make a show-stopping Chocolate Chip Skillet Cookie.

programme.title: The Italian American Kitchen
programme.desc: Test cook Ashley Moore reveals the secrets to achieving the ultimate Sausage Ragu in a time crunch. Next, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Bridget Lancaster to a fettuccine taste test. And finally, test cook Bryan Roof teaches host Julia Collin Davison how to make a spectacular Fluffy Baked Polenta with Red Sauce.

programme.title: Pacific Northwest Supper
programme.desc: Test cook Christie Morrison shows host Julia Collin Davison how to make a showstopping Oregon Blackberry Pie. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried shows host Bridget Lancaster his top pick for pie plates. Next, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Julia to a tasting of ready-made pie crusts. And finally, Bridget and Julia make an easy one-pan supper-Roasted Salmon with Broccoli and Red Potatoes.

programme.title: Summer Steak and Salad
programme.desc: Test cook Christie Morrison makes host Bridget Lancaster the ultimate Grilled Thick-Cut Porterhouse Steaks. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried shows host Julia Collin Davison his top pick for paring knives. Next, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of crumbled blue cheese. And finally, test cook Lan Lam makes Julia the best Caesar Green Beans.

programme.title: Refreshing Desserts
programme.desc: Host Bridget Lancaster goes into the test kitchen with test cook Dan Souza to learn how to make the best Ginger Frozen Yogurt at home. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews digital scales in the equipment corner. Next, gadget expert Lisa McManus uncovers the best personal blenders. Finally, test cook Tim Chin shows host Julia Collin Davison how to make perfect Lemon Posset with Berries.

programme.title: A Taste of History - Flavors of the Pinoleros
programme.desc: Chef Walter Staib travels to the Land of Lakes and Volcanoes Nicaragua! From touring antique markets to preparing traditional favorites like vigarón and baho, Staib gives an intimate look into the history and flavors of the Nicaraguans.

programme.title: Dine & Dish Nation - Lovers Only El Barzon The Rattlesnake Club
programme.desc: Host Kam Carman welcomes Barbara Johnson, Jarod Robert and Elizabeth Kraft, who review upscale sandwiches and salads at Lovers Only Mexican and Italian specialties a la Chef Norberto Garita at El Barzon and steaks and seafood at the Rattlesnake Club located on the Detroit Riverfront.

programme.title: Graham Kerr's Kitchen - Smoked Turkey Stuffed Peppers
programme.desc: Sweet red bell peppers are stuffed with smoked ground turkey, crispy jicama, hot jalapeno peppers, kidney beans and rice. Then serve with a creamy cilantro and cheese sauce or roll in Swiss chard leaves and bake in tomato-vegetable juice.

programme.title: Hawaii Cooks with Roy Yamaguchi - Palms and Ferns
programme.desc: Hawaii Cooks explores the rare and the unusual with visits to two farms growing specialty produce. Hana Herbs on Maui produces delicate fiddlehead ferns, a farmer's dream because they require no pesticide, fertilizer, irrigation or expensive harvesting machinery. We then travel to the lush Hamakua coast of the Big Island to Ninole Orchard.

programme.title: Justin Wilson's Easy Cookin' - Crawfish Maque Chou & Crawfish/Shrimp Cocktail
programme.desc: Join Justin as he demonstrates how to prepare and cook Crawfish Maque Chou & Crawfish/Shrimp Cocktail!

programme.title: What's For Dinner? Vegetarian Cabbage Rolls
programme.desc: Ken and Mary Jo have a fun time in the kitchen cooking vegetarian cabbage rolls, plus a few other excellent dishes.

programme.title: From Scratch - Ruben Sandwich
programme.desc: Today, Chef Joe bakes bread with his mother and daughter and makes the classic Ruben Sandwich.

programme.title: The Kitchen Wisdom of Cecilia Chiang - Last Flight Out Of Shanghai
programme.desc: In this episode, Cecilia joins Chef Keiko Takahashi, the first Japanese woman in the world to win a Michelin star. She and her husband run Keiko on Nob Hill, a place that feels like a private club, and where the luxurious cooking has a distinct feminine style to it.

programme.title: Nick Stellino: Storyteller in the Kitchen - Mis Amigos
programme.desc: Nick addresses how living in Southern California has led him to appreciate the culinary culture of Latino food and shares the recipes he has explored due to this influence. Dishes Include: Spicy Corn Salad / Poached Chicken Breast with Mole Sauce / Gazpacho "Stellino Style".

programme.title: Ciao Italia - Little Surprise Packages / Piccoli Pacchetti a Sorpresa
programme.desc: Mary Ann takes to the streets to enjoy one of Sicily’s favorites: Panzerotti Palermitani, freshly made dough, stuffed with mozzarella “pearls” and tomato sauce, shaped like a turnover and then fried to a golden crisp. Then chickpeas take center stage for a sweet ravioli filled with chocolate, cinnamon, citron, honey, and toasted almonds.

programme.title: Martin Yan's Chinatowns - The Reunion
programme.desc: Respect and Confucian beliefs come into play as Martin has a reunion with his teacher and boyhood friends from China who now live in New York. This episode's recipes include: Stir-Fried Beef with Bitter Melon, Braised Fish Fillet with Tofu Puff, and Daikon and Bean Thread Noodles.

programme.title: Primal Grill - Gaucho Grill
programme.desc: There's something about the open range that brings out the griller in all of us. Recipes include: Gaucho Beef Ribs, Brazilian Pineapple and Salt-Crusted Chicken.

programme.title: Michael Chiarello's Napa - Mama's Favorites
programme.desc: Foods that warm the heart and soothe the soul. A ten-minute technique for making olives bright and lively, homemade mozzarella, which we serve en carrozza – in a "carriage" of bread dipped in egg and anchovies – and turkey polpettone filled with a center of melting cheese. We'll learn the stories behind the valley's scenic, historic stone walls.

programme.title: Lidias Italian Table - Gnocchi
programme.desc: Gnocchi is a Lidia favorite. As a child, it was a Sunday dinner staple on the Matticchio table, which Lidia helped her mother cook. The secret to great gnocchi is making it light and fluffy, then shaping it. Lidia makes two gnocchi dishes: gnocchi in Lidia’s plain tomato sauce and gnocchi rolled and filled with ricotta/spinach/leek stuffing, dressed with a savory sage butter sauce.

programme.title: Infusion - Fish
programme.desc: Today on Infusion, we look at the various way fish are used in cooking.

programme.title: Julia & Jacques Cooking at Home - Comfort Food
programme.desc: Poached chicken, chicken pot pie and rustic apple tart dessert. Julia and Jacques show how simple it is to poach a chicken with vegetables, mushrooms and a little white wine, and then take that poaching liquid and use it with the leftover poached chicken for a flaky crusted chicken pot pie. The same simple pastry Julia makes for the pot pie is perfect base for a rustic apple and dried fruit tart.

programme.title: Refugee Chef - Afghan at Last
programme.desc: For 28 years, Javad Ghaderi kept his Afghan nationality a secret. He was an asylum seeker for all of those years, and endured deportation 3 times. It was food that helped him at critical junctions, and now he is using Persian cuisine to solidify new friendships with locals in Wollongong, Australia.

programme.title: Refugee Chef - Beyond Bali
programme.desc: Anita Saborn is a former Indonesian refugee living in Paris. She arrived as a political refugee in the 70s, and their family run the first Indonesian restaurant in the city. When Anita took over the restaurant from her father, she decided to serve Indonesian food as it is - spicy and full-bodied.

programme.title: Refugee Chef - Redefining Shangri-Lai
programme.desc: Chef Dorjee was a Tibetan Buddhist monk before he settled down in USA. He decided the best way to answer the question of 'Where are you from?' is to give someone a taste of his homeland. Dorjee Momos, a refugee-owned, family-run Tibetan nomad food start-up, was born.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Ceiling Fan, Bonsai
programme.desc: Electrician Scott Caron helps a homeowner replace an undersized ceiling fan with a more appropriate one. Kevin, Tom, Richard and Roger ask ""What Is It?"" Later, Roger visits a bonsai nursery to learn the art of sculpting trees.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Lightning, Sink Filter
programme.desc: Kevin and Roger meet with Meteorologist Jim Cantore to discuss Jim's biggest weather fear‰Û_ÌãÌ¨lightning. Roger heads to Orlando to see a lightning protection system installed. Richard helps a homeowner install a reverse osmosis filter for drinking water. And the guys ask, ""What Is It?"

programme.title: Ask TOH | Lighting, Water Main
programme.desc: Electrician Scott Caron heads to Cleveland to install some landscape lighting. Kevin, Tom, Richard and Roger ask ""What Is It?"" Then Richard replaces a water main shutoff.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Mailbox, Reuse Door
programme.desc: Roger helps a homeowner replace a mailbox that was damaged by a snowplow. Kevin shares some information about window anatomy. Tom helps a homeowner reuse an old door in a new opening. And the guys ask, ""What Is It?"

programme.title: Ask TOH | Noisy Heat, New Lights
programme.desc: Tom and Kevin discuss kitchen island dimensions. Richard helps a homeowner quiet a noisy baseboard heating system. The guys ask, ""What Is It?"" Later Electrician Scott Caron helps a homeowner add light to a kitchen by install three new recessed cans.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Houseplants, US Flag
programme.desc: Roger heads to Maine to help a homeowner plant an indoor tropical garden with plants from Jamaica. Richard, Roger, Kevin and Tom ask ""What Is It?"" Richard shows how to change the temperature on water heaters. Then Tom and Kevin built an American flag out of reclaimed wood.

programme.title: Ask TOH | EV Charger, New Sink
programme.desc: Electrician Scott Caron helps a homeowner install an electric vehicle charger next to his house. The guys ask, ""What Is It?"" Then, Richard helps a homeowner install a new kitchen sink and faucet.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Thermostat, Solar
programme.desc: Roger teaches Kevin about lengths to consider when mowing the lawn. Richard travels to Pittsburgh to install a thermostat that interfaces with a smartphone to save energy and money. Ross Trethewey walks Kevin through the installation of a photovoltaic solar array on the barn. And Kevin, along with Tom, Richard and Roger ask, ""What Is It?"

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | 35 Years of This Old House
programme.desc: In celebration of 35 years of This Old House, we look back at all that's changed in the last 35 years, and also what hasn't: our commitment to delivering trusted ideas and information to empower homeowners. This season begins in Boston's oldest neighborhood, Charlestown. Kevin and Norm highlight Charlestown's historical importance, from colonial times through WWII. Our new project is part of a cluster of 1850s-era Greek Revival houses tucked into the backside of Bunker Hill. Homeowner Angela Daigle shows Kevin the period feel and features of her home that she loves, but also the outdated kitchen and poor organization of space that she'd like to improve. Upstairs, Tom Silva shows Norm the spaces that will be getting minimal work: an existing guest room, guest bath, and living room. But one level up, on the third floor, it will likely be a full gut to give Angela a better master suite with additional living space, assuming the City approves the plan to enlarge the existing dormers. Out back, Roger shows Kevin the sad state of the crumbling retaining walls. Then Kevin finds Richard formulating a plan for the basement. Norm stops in next door to meet Maggie Boone to see how she recently addressed a lot of the same issues that Angela faces by renovating her own row house. And Norm and Tom test for lead paint before beginning demo on the first floor, as downstairs, Kevin, Richard and mason Mark McCullough start digging into the project.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Brick Rowhouse Blues
programme.desc: Kevin arrives to find Tom solving a major problem with the house: The exterior walls are bowing out from the weight of the roof over 160 years. His solution: build a structural wall inbound of the brick, lash the brick to the structure with threaded rods and epoxy, and then parge the whole thing. In the basement, news is brighter: Richard shows Kevin the result of two weeks of hand digging and a week of rough plumbing. The floor is down several inches, the sewer line tucked neatly in the floor, and the radiant heat/insulation system is currently going in. On the third floor, Norm shows Kevin how the roof has been under-structured since it was originally built. The structure they added in the 1980s helped, but it still needs more. Tom joins to get the first of two massive LVLs tucked into the pockets in the brick sidewalls, and fastened in place. To see how it's holding up, Norm revisits the townhouse we renovated in Charlestown 14 years ago. Back at our house, Tom shows Kevin how he's going to open up the back wall for the new bump out. It starts with using two temporary steel "needles" through the reinforced rear wall to hold the weight of the house while a new steel beam is inserted. Then, the bricks can come down one by one to make a small new addition for the breakfast area.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | A Bridge to Charlestown
programme.desc: Richard gets up close and personal with one of Charlestown's most iconic structures-the Zakim Bridge-by talking with the structural engineer on the project, Ted Zoli. At the project house, Kevin finds the front of the building obscured by scaffolding it will be used to replace the failing asphalt roof, and also to build the dormer, if approval comes in from the City. Inside, Tom shows Kevin how he'll have to modify the old chimney for the new gas fireplace units, and they see the framing progress, including the new bump out for the breakfast area. The third floor master suite is all framed up, save the dormer, which is still in regulatory limbo. In the backyard, mason Mark McCullough presents options for rebuilding the decaying retaining walls at different price points. Then, they dig into the demolition, carrying all of the old wall material out through the house, by hand. Norm visits a salvage yard in Boston's South End that has dozens of architectural elements from the Greek Revival period, including a marble mantel and some glass doorknobs that are perfect for Angela's house. Several days later, Mark starts installing the homeowner's choice for the retaining wall: an interlocking concrete system with a bluestone cap. Richard shows Kevin the progress on the rough plumbing and electrical, including a high velocity mini duct system that will pair with an electric inverter heat pump unit to supply either air handlers or high wall cassette units. It's an efficient and quiet solution, which is perfect for this close-knit City location.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Wood and Water
programme.desc: Richard stops by the Charlestown Navy Yard to see a very special guest arrive: the last wooden whaling ship in the world, the Charles W. Morgan, which was built c.1840, just a decade before our project house. At the jobsite, Norm finds architect Sally DeGan, who shares the good news that after months of work and waiting, our new dormer was finally approved. Up at the roofline, Tom shows Norm the progress on the dormer, and how he's carefully waterproofing its low slope roof. Inside, Kevin notes progress: insulation went in a few days ago and wallboard is going up. Out back, to tie in the new work with the old house, mason Mark McCullough installs a reclaimed brick veneer on the new kitchen bump out. Kevin drops in to see kitchen designer Kathy Marshall at her studio in Wenham, Massachusetts, where she is working on the interior design details with homeowner Angela Daigle. For a more authentic look, Norm and Tom replace the fake, applied vinyl shutters on our house with authentic, operable shutters make out of durable fiberglass and PVC.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Gardens and Greek Revival
programme.desc: Roger visits the Sullivan Square Community Garden, while Richard works with fireplace expert John Sullivan to rough in the ductwork for the new direct vent gas fireplace units. With plaster work and flooring completed, Norm and Tom add some subtle Greek Revival details to the interior window trim package. For inspiration for her own urban garden, Roger takes homeowner Angela Daigle to see some the hidden gardens of Beacon Hill. Painting contractor Mauro Henrique paints the exterior window trim on our rowhouse, and puts up samples of a few bold color choices for the new front door

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Kitchens and Baths
programme.desc: Kevin finds Tom getting ready for a major upgrade to the front of the house: a new four-panel front door with glass transom and sidelights in traditional Greek Revival style. Inside, Kevin and Tom recall some of their favorite TOH kitchens over the years before seeing another one in progress Angela's cabinets have arrived from Pennsylvania. On the second floor, Tom and Kevin install new wood wainscoting to replace the worn out, poorly made version that used to be there. Norm learns about Charlestown's ancient past from city archaeologist Joe Bagley, who provides a rare look at his warehouse of artifacts in storage and testing at Boston's own archaeology lab. Tile contractor Mark Ferrante uses a marble basket weave tile from an online supplier to make a feature wall insert in the master shower. At the back addition, Kevin and Tom install a small section of copper roof to add a bit of character and long-term durability to the small roof

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Rowhouse, Lighthouse
programme.desc: Tom builds a hidden door to the basement by concealing it behind a system of rails and stiles that look like paneling. Marble specialist Danny Puccio shows Kevin the new Carrara marble island top and how they made the delicate ogee edge detail back at the shop. Angela gives Roger the news that despite a beautiful new design for her backyard, her budget is beyond stretched and she'll have to hold off on planting until next year. Fence contractor Mark Bushway installs a new PVC fence on top of the retaining wall to provide some privacy for the backyard. Richard heads out on the water to see how one intrepid homeowner is turning one of Boston's iconic lighthouses into his family's summer home. Norm and Tom restore the old, weather beaten exterior front steps with a grinder, a router, some epoxy, and a non-slip exterior paint. Stone specialist Steve Torok installs the salvaged marble mantel and surround in the sitting room

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | A Rowhouse Reimagined
programme.desc: After five months of work in Charlestown, the exterior is nicely restored thanks to a new dormer, windows, shutters, and front entry. Inside, Kevin finds systems integrator Greg Smizer test-driving the new internet-based security system, wireless music system and remote controlled window shades with solar battery back up. Norm meets closet designer Brian McSharry to see the pros and cons of designing a closet around a window. Richard shows Angela the basics of cooking with induction technology: her new cooktop relies on a magnetic field to generate heat within the pots and pans, instead of a traditional heating element. Norm meets up with Richard in the partially unfinished basement to see the mechanical room, where the systems integrate to provide comfort for the whole house. Kevin checks out Angela's new outdoor kitchen: powder coated stainless steel cabinets, a gas grill, and soapstone countertops. On the third floor, Kevin finds Angela and her mission accomplished: a serene master suite retreat where she can rest and relax. On the second floor, interior designer Kathy Marshall shows Norm the changes to the guest room, guest bath and bold new living room painted cranberry red, even on the ceiling. Downstairs, Kathy joins Angela and Kevin to see the former dining room transformed into a sophisticated sitting room, and all of the details of the new kitchen: cabinetry, tile, storage, a splashy new powder room, and the window seat addition that was worth all of the hard work

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Colonial Roots
programme.desc: This Old House kicks off the second project of their 35th Anniversary Season: an addition to a 1966 Colonial Revival in historic Lexington, Mass. With a history that extends back to the time of the American Revolution, Lexington is home to a strong tradition of Colonial-style homes that are still popular today. Homeowners Jeremy and Jody Kieval love the neighborhood but not necessarily the tall trees that hide the front of their house they'd like a curb appeal makeover that includes more sunlight and a big new farmer's porch. Inside, the front hall and dining room are working well, but the overflowing playroom needs to be relocated. Jeremy loves to cook and wants his dream kitchen to become the new heart of the home, so the nearly 50-year-old kitchen will be gutted and redesigned. Jody laments the lack of mudroom and access to the garage-but all of that will be taken care of by the new addition. All of the new upstairs space goes to the girls: the plan is to add two more bedrooms, a laundry room, and a sitting area over the garage. Norm meets architect Bill Hubner to discuss the features of the existing house, and how he's incorporated them into a plan for a sympathetic addition. In the 1980s-era great room, Richard explains why the tall room is hard to heat despite the best efforts of the baseboard and electric heat. Downstairs, the lack of insulation needs to be addressed and the heating and cooling systems may not be sized to support all of the new work in the addition. Roger shows Kevin the small stream in the backyard and the lengths that we're going go through to protect it during construction.

programme.title: My Fair Wedding:"Candy Bride" Dayira
programme.desc: It takes a lot to shock wedding planner David Tutera, but bride Dayira Muniz is about to do just that. Three weeks before her big day, this sweets-loving bride has stocked up on candy accessories and edible decor for her candy-themed wedding.

programme.title: My Fair Wedding: "Purple Bride" Nicole
programme.desc: Her wedding is just three weeks away, but bride Nicole's wedding is spinning out of control. Enter David Tutera, who starts by changing the wedding theme to reflect the bride's Jamaican heritage.

programme.title: My Fair Wedding:"The Steel Magnolia Bride" Noelle Kane
programme.desc: For her wedding, soon to be bride Noelle Kane wants to combine the simple comforts of the South with the excitement of a big city. David decides it would be easier to just bring the South to the big city!

programme.title: My Fair Wedding:"The 50s Hollywood Glamour Bride" Corryn Conyer
programme.desc: Harlem bride Corryn Conyer has dreamt of looking like Audrey Hepburn on her wedding day. When David meets Corryn three weeks before her big day, he realizes her wedding was far from a fairytale ending.

programme.title: My Fair Wedding:"The West Side Story Bride" Christina Velez
programme.desc: Christina Velez and fiance Ed Rangel were ready to exchange vows on a Mexican beach, but their plans changed following the outbreak of "swine flu."

programme.title: My Fair Wedding:"The Golden Bride" Varneka Edwards
programme.desc: Living in Bear, Delaware is nothing like living in New York City, but that hasn't stopped David Tutera's latest bride, Varneka Edwards, from trying to bring the Big Apple to town on her wedding day.

programme.title: Marriage Boot Camp: Reality Stars:Road Rage
programme.desc: The stars navigate the hazards of dominance. A controlling Soulja Boy drives Nia over the edge. Lil' Fizz and Tiffany take an unexpected turn. Waka Flocka and Tammy crash and burn over past issues of infidelity.

programme.title: Marriage Boot Camp: Reality Stars:Hashtag Drama
programme.desc: The stars are put on blast when a surprise press conference digs up dirty laundry from their social media. Later, the couples are ambushed by a wife swap! Jealousy wreaks havoc over the house when old flames, Lil' Fizz and Nia, are reconnected.

programme.title: Marriage Boot Camp: Reality Stars:Mazed and Confused
programme.desc: When a stressful communication drill fails, the doctors confront the smoking issue. Tiffany seeks answers from Fizz and Nia. Soulja Boy is left feeling under water. And a boot camper is caught on camera facetiming someone other than their partner.

programme.title: Marriage Boot Camp: Reality Stars:Sex
programme.desc: The couples learn that Sex Day is not all fun and games when one person is caught Facetiming someone other than their partner. Soulja lets jealousy get the best of him, leaving Nia wanting to go home alone. And Lil' Mo wonders what is Karl hiding?

programme.title: Marriage Boot Camp: Reality Stars:Breaking Bad
programme.desc: After Karl was caught FaceTiming another woman, Lil' Mo demands answers. The couples are shook when special guests force them to confront their traumatic past. Drama erupts when Nia encounters Soulja's problem child.

programme.title: Marriage Boot Camp: Reality Stars:Mo Honey, Mo Problems
programme.desc: The couples face a dangerous challenge in an ultimate test of sacrifice. An explosive blowup shakes Soulja and Nia to their core. Lil Mo gets revenge on Karl for FaceTiming another woman. Tiffany feels abandoned when Fizz stings her heart.

programme.title: Marriage Boot Camp: Reality Stars:Lyin' Dirty
programme.desc: The couples sweat it out in the hot seat during a surprise lie detector test and deception is indicated. The stars hit the club for a single's night out where temptation strikes at every turn and someone gets caught in the act.

programme.title: Marriage Boot Camp: Reality Stars:Re-lit or Quit
programme.desc: After 10 Days of Boot Camp, the couples must decide if they'll stay together or leave apart. Has Lil' Mo finally had enough of Karl's lies? Will Soulja Boy pop the question? And after Jessica's deception, will she and Shawne leave engaged or enraged?

programme.title: Marriage Boot Camp: Reality Stars:It Ain't All Gucci
programme.desc: Five of Hip Hop's hottest couples enter Boot Camp and exes reunite! The stars are blindsided when the VIP club flips into Divorce Court! Things pop off when shocking issues are exposed. Later, the couples are bombarded by an unpleasant surprise.

programme.title: Marriage Boot Camp: Reality Stars:Drop It Like It's Hot
programme.desc: The stars go head-to-head over who's to blame in an epic rap battle. Nia drops a bomb on Soulja Boy and all hell breaks loose! The stars sweat it out in the hot seat when they are served a plate of their burning issues. A battle of the exes ignites.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 7, 13 Chefs Compete" - With an emphasis on teamwork, Chef Ramsay challenges the teams to serve lunch to members of the USC Trojans marching band. The chefs cook burgers, salads and fries.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 7, 12 Chefs Compete (Part One)" - The remaining chefs must roll the dice to determine their next ingredients. The winning team enjoys a thrilling wind tunnel experience while the losers clean up.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 7, 12 Chefs Compete (Part Two)" - The chefs must prepare dishes consisting of pork cuts and side items. Chef Ramsay surprises the contestants with the first-ever "Hell's Kitchen" barbecue.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 7, 11 Chefs Compete" - The remaining chefs must make meals out of the five "mother sauces" without reusing any of the other twenty ingredients. The winning team gets to visit an English pub.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 7, 10 Chefs Compete" - For the season's seventh dinner service, "Hell's Kitchen" hosts a fiftieth wedding anniversary. The chefs must update the classic dishes served at the original wedding reception.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 7, 9 Chefs Compete" - The aspiring chefs must make unique sandwiches. The winners spend a day in California's wine country while the losers grind the peanuts for the next day's dinner service.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 7, 8 Chefs Compete" - Chef Ramsay tests the remaining chefs' palates in a blind taste test. The winning team enjoys a day at Sea World while the losers unload deliveries of trout.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 7, 7 Chefs Compete" - The chefs must create unique lobster dishes to be judged by Michelin star chefs. The winners enjoy a visit to a caviar house, followed by a shopping spree.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 7, 6 Chefs Compete" - In their first individual challenge, the chefs must create dishes that look as good as they taste. The winner's dish will appear in a food magazine.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 7, 5 Chefs Compete" - Each chef can only spend ten dollars on ingredients for their next meal. A jury of gourmands taste the dishes and estimate how much they would pay for them.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Peter's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Peter's, a family-run Italian restaurant in Babylon, New York. He discovers that the eatery is sinking because of its brash manager and co-owner.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Dillon's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay is in the Big Apple to revamp Dillon's, an Indian restaurant just blocks away from his own thriving eatery. Stubborn owner Mohammed loses approximately $25,000-$50,000 a month.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Amy's Baking Company
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay heads to Scottsdale, Arizona to fix a failing restaurant with nauseating food and inadequate service.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Return to Amy's Baking Company
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay returns to Scottsdale to visit Amy's Baking Company. We see an interview with the owners, previously unseen footage and initial reactions to Gordon's first visit.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: The Secret Garden
programme.desc: The Secret Garden is a romantic French restaurant that is on the brink of bankruptcy. Chef Ramsay causes a stir as he suggests changing the ugly décor, the menu and the filthy kitchen.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Lela's
programme.desc: Lela's is an upscale restaurant in desperate need of clientele. When Chef Ramsay starts criticizing the menu, the executive chef sees red, leading to a showdown in front of the staff.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Sebastian's
programme.desc: Sebastian's prepares frozen food from a complex menu and the wait staff is more concerned about auditioning for their acting roles than serving meals.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Casa Roma
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Casa Roma, an Italian restaurant in Lancaster, California. Although its bar is packed, Casa Roma's dining area is nearly empty. Most of the problems stem from the inexperienced owners managing a clueless kitchen staff.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Mama Rita's
programme.desc: Ramsay finds that the Mexican eatery Mama Rita's suffers from a disorganized kitchen. Meanwhile, the owner may have to sacrifice a friendship in order to save her business.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Sushi Ko
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay finds a failing second location of a family-owned eatery. Debt, a breakdown of the family dynamic and a relative who has lost his passion for cooking all plague the restaurant.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Women on the Go" - For the Michael Kors Challenge, the designers are tasked with making an outfit for a woman on the go—something chic and stylish but wearable enough to last throughout the entire day. Also, the designers are left in a state of confusion as two of their fellow competitors abruptly decide to leave Project Runway.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "It's My Way on the Runway" - In the Marie Claire Challenge, the designers are once again split off into teams to design a fashion capsule collection for the new magazine Marie Claire at Work. The teams also must direct a fashion shoot for their collection, which is also part of the criteria they are judged on for this challenge.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Fix My Friend" - In a challenge for L'Oreal, the designers team up with clients whose friends or loved ones are in desperate need of a makeover. The designers must consult and work with their clients to give them a new and flattering look that is also conducive to their lifestyle.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Oh My Lord and Taylor" - For the Lord and Taylor Challenge, the designers receive the opportunity to design a look for a capsule collection that celebrates ten seasons of Project Runway. If chosen as the winner, their look would join the ranks of many former Project Runway designers and winners, and it would be manufactured and sold at Lord and Taylor.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Starving Artist" - For this challenge, the designers divided into teams of three, and they must raise their own shopping money by selling t-shirts and other designs on the streets of NYC. Once they have raised their money, they have to design a two-piece fall collection, and one look must include a piece of outerwear.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "It's All About Me" - For the HP Challenge, the designers must create their own textile and design a look that is representative of their heritage. They are surprised when a member of their family comes for a surprise visit and helps them with their inspiration.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "I Get a Kick Out of Fashion" - The designers are treated to a show at Radio City Music Hall, where they learn that they will be designing an outfit for the world-famous Rockettes to wear in an upcoming performance.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "It's Fashion Baby" - For Heidi's challenge, the designers arrive at Babies R Us where they learn that they will be designing an outfit for their youngest clients yet—babies! In a twist of fate, they are also made to take care of "real" babies: dolls that cry when they need to be changed, fed, or burped. And if that wasn't enough, Heidi throws another twist at the designers they also must create a complementary look for the baby's mom to wear.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "In a Place Far, Far Away" - As the designers face their final challenge before Mercedes Benz Fashion Week, they are tasked with their most difficult and creative challenge yet: making an avant-garde look inspired by L'Oreal's new line of makeup called "Electric Fantasie".

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Finale Part 1" - Weak and weary from their journey, the few designers left say goodbye to NYC and return to their respective hometowns to begin working on their final collections. Tim Gunn travels to visit the designers and assess their progress. In the end, all four remaining designers must present their three best pieces to the judging panel, as the judges are left to decide who will move on to show at Mercedes Benz Fashion Week.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Finale Part 2" - It's the moment of truth for the remaining designers as they each present their final collections to an eager audience at Mercedes Benz Fashion Week. One designer is named the winner of Project Runway Season 10, and the rest are unfortunately out.

Su líder Jesús de Nazaret insufla ilusión en los corazones. programme.title: I'M LIVE: S1 E216
programme.desc: Joining us on this week's I'm LIVE is singer Sam Kim! This artist made himself known to the public in 2013 as the runner-up of the popular talent show "K-pop Star Season 3." Then he made his official debut in 2016 and has been mesmerizing listeners with his velvety voice and songwriting skills since then. Thanks to his outstanding musicality, he has also worked with a number of A-list musicians, including IU, Crush, Zico, and more. In June this year, Sam Kim released his new single "The Juice" after a break of about 2 years. With a blend of retro pop and hip hop, this autobiographic song depicts his worn-out state of mind interestingly through groovy dance moves. So he has proved that he can sing, compose, and even dance, making us eagerly anticipate what more he has in store for us. In this episode, Sam Kim performs "The Juice," "Make Up," "Seattle" and more to showcase the quintessence of his artistry. Tune in to I'm LIVE and meet this talented singer!

programme.title: RiffTrax Presents: Junior Prom

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - The Phantom Creeps

This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Flash That Smile

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Marriage is a Partnership
programme.desc: The honeymoon is over for newlyweds Dotty and Pete. Now they face the reality of married life, which, according to “Marriage is A Partnership”, is a slow moving train headed right for you. Join Bridget and Mary Jo from RiffTrax as they learn a thing or two about marriage in this short featuring frank depictions of bridge games and frosting cakes.

programme.title: RIFFTRAX PRESENTS - Snowbeast
programme.desc: Join Matthew J Elliot and Ian Potter as they check out this 1970s TV-movie-of-the-week, detailing what happens when Bigfoot goes on vacation. So settle in for the evening and enjoy Snowbeast!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Cops: Who Needs Them?
